newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: AUSTRALIA YIELD SPREADS-SHORT-END OUTPACES BLOC.
newsitem.headline: AUSTRALIA YIELD SPREADS-SHORT-END OUTPACES BLOC.

text.p: The short-end of the Australian yield curve put in a strong performance against the dollar bloc, spurred by comments by Reserve Bank governor Ian Macfarlane late on Tuesday.

Macfarlane was seen leaving open the possibility of a further easing in monetary polic, but he also said Australia's lower interest rates against the U.S. were entirely "fit and proper" given that the two countries are at different cyclical positions.

The local long end also managed to outperform the U.S. on the day, although the weight of uncertainty in the U.S. market ahead of the July U.S. retail sales data later on Wednesday meant that any spread narrowing was a tough challenge.
However, the Australian/U.S. 10-year yield spread remained well above the low of some 25 basis points seen last week.
U.S. PPI for July is also due on Wednesday.
